question:
A company runs an application that uses Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL. The application receives traffic only on weekdays during business hours. The company wants to optimize costs and reduce operational overhead based on this usage.

Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.A: Use the Instance Scheduler on AWS to configure start and stop schedules.
options.B: Turn off automatic backups. Create weekly manual snapshots of the database.
options.C: Create a custom AWS Lambda function to start and stop the database based on minimum CPU utilization.
options.D: Purchase All Upfront reserved DB instances.

explanation: Instance Scheduler on AWS is a solution that automatically starts and stops RDS instances based on schedules. This optimizes costs by stopping the database outside business hours while reducing operational overhead with automated scheduling.
